subject: AI & Agents
title: ChatGPT: AI Goes Mainstream
description: A micro-lesson that makes ChatGPT: AI Goes Mainstream usable.

hook.text: November 30, 2022. OpenAI launches ChatGPT. It reaches 100 million users in two months.

buildup.text: ChatGPT combined GPT-3.5 with RLHF to create an AI that felt natural to talk to.

discovery.text: For the first time, non-technical people experienced powerful AI firsthand through conversation.

twist.text: Schools panicked. Companies scrambled. Competitors raced to catch up. Nothing was the same after.

climax.text: ChatGPT didn't invent the technology. It made it accessible. That was the real breakthrough.

punchline.text: The revolution wasn't the model. It was the interface.

quiz.question: What made ChatGPT a mainstream breakthrough?
options: It made powerful AI accessible through a simple conversational interface
It was the first language model ever built
It could only be used by researchers
